Hugh Winkler wrote:
> Then you're not using  HATEOAS. The semantics of the hypertext tells you 
> whether you can PUT something there, and what you should expect to happen.
> 
> HTTP != REST, of course. Perfectly OK to rely on OPTIONS under HTTP, but 
> not RESTful.

And that's because the OPTIONS response is text, not hypertext?

Julian (shaking his head)
